metadata.title: CVE-2016-2177 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
OpenSSL through 1.0.2h incorrectly uses pointer arithmetic for heap-bufferboundary checks, which might allow remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (integer overflow and application crash) or possibly haveunspecified other impact by leveraging unexpected malloc behavior, relatedto s3_srvr.c, ssl_sess.c, and t1_lib.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2177` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.1 - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu9
openssl - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: openssl package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.2g-1ubuntu9').
